fields.description:
The launch instance and create launch config wizards have an option to create a keypair in the security step, however I had no idea that the keyhole was saved to my desktop. Maybe the popup that says that the create was successful can also indicate the file was saved to your computer and the path? Better yet, have the option to specify the location!
!http://i.imgur.com/TipneMM.png!
fields.summary: Create keypair option from wizards does not tell you it saved the file for you

comments.body: Well, that's certainly a mistake. Functionality should be create and download from everywhere. Probably just needs a button text update.
p.s. option to specify the location is browser-controlled.

The text on the dialog should give the user a heads-up that once they hit create, the file is automatically downloaded. This prompts them to be sure they know where it got downloaded to so they _can_ save it in a location they'll remember.
Re-capture if button label or dialog text changes.

[~tony], which browser did yo use? I'm attaching a screen-shot from when I created a keypair in the instance wizard and it asked me what to do with it.
I notice FF asks me, but Chrome puts the file in "downloads" and shows it in the lower bar of the browser. (also attaching screen shot, and of configuration setting to change that in Chrome)
Button text should be changed from "Create Key Pair" to "Create and Download"
Will change button label from "Create Key Pair" to "Create and Download."
As you suggested, I changed the create key pair dialog button from "Create Key Pair" to "Create and Download."
[~lnajjar], is this in a branch? Where did you change it?

Changed the file you listed in the Comments above: create_keypair_dialog.pt. Did a Commit with the Push check box selected. Moved the ticket to "In Review" and asked [~jloza] to review.

Since she is now out for a couple of weeks, should I do a Pull Request?
Before anything goes in review, we do a PR. That's how the reviewer can review it. We talked about relying on people other than her while she's away so things will get done. Assign to me for review.
In Jenny's absence, will you please review this one?
